review:
O jogo Ã© bem bonito e as mecÃ¢nicas de furtividade foram ampliadas em relaÃ§Ã£o ao Assassin's Creed Chronicles China, o que me agradou bastante e acho que jÃ¡ fez o jogo valer a pena pelo preÃ§o de promoÃ§Ã£o que paguei. Mas achei que esse jogo forÃ§a fases de fuga / tempo muito desagradÃ¡veis, com objetivos caÃ³ticos e sendo muito estressante conseguir o menor tempo. O ACC China era bem mais equilibrado nesse sentido. A histÃ³ria do China era bem, bem melhor, enquanto que nesse a histÃ³ria Ã© rasa e atÃ© assustei quando o jogo acabou porque nÃ£o achei que fez sentido aquilo ser o final. Joguei 20 horas no China (e pretendo jogar mais, pra fazer o modo Dificil), nesse foram 11 e nem tÃ´ com tanta vontade de jogar mais, talvez sÃ³ tente pegar algumas conquistas e Ã© isso.

Veredito final: vale a pena na promoÃ§Ã£o (enquanto o China vale a pena pelo preÃ§o total).

author: {'steamid': '76561198320140625', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1585413859}
review: This I found is tougher than the 3D series. Get ready for timed missions which you have to keep on trying, also timed trapdoors and puzzles, overall its very challenging. I myself had to repeat so many areas so many times. There are some UI issues for example I cannot return to the main menu from the challenge menu and graphics settings cannot be altered barring the resolution and vsync. I would recommend this only if you have patience and time on your hand and you dont mind breaking your keyboard often :-P

author: {'steamid': '76561199013517615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1699241399}
review: Ubisoft never ceases to amaze with their creativity. Essentially, Assassin's Creed Chronicles: India's story arc uses an engine very similar to the retro Prince of Persia, which took me a moment to realize. This is because the modern graphics, gameplay and moves nearly create an original experience. Initially, i wondered what India would offer in setting that Egypt doesn't (Assassin's Creed Origins). However, i was delightfully suprised that the music and art in India successfully distinguishes itself. I never felt once as if i was in Bayek's world, which was my biggest apprehension. Ubisoft truly understands diversity and cater to a more realistic audience. Itis incredible that as someone not particularly invested in Indian culture that i ended up rather intrigued by this game. Kudos to Ubisoft. I love this game

review:
I just finished the ACC: China game and entered India... to learn he not only get allt he abilities you had to work for in the first game right in the first mission, but also that its almost impossible for a casual gamer to get any upgrades in this game... i finished first chapter with 1200points but need 2500 for a upgrade... the fuck!?

Also this is like Hardmode of CHina... i gave up in third Mission cause I couldn't get passt the guard with Bells next to him... tried 40times just to get past him, didn't work in any way, even the videos online don't help as it goes off afterall...

no thanks, if I could refund i would!

Optymalizacja jest oczywiÅ›cie fantastyczna â€“ RTX 2070 z procesorem 9 generacji na najwyÅ¼szych ustawieniach graficznych w rozdzielczoÅ›ci 1920x1080 (FHD) gwarantuje 144kl/s. DziÄ™ki temu aÅ¼ przyjemniej siÄ™ po prostu przechodzi kolejne etapy tej produkcji.

Po raz drugi wykonali porzÄ…dnie swojÄ… robotÄ™, jednak utwory nie sÄ… aÅ¼ tak klimatyczne, jak to miaÅ‚o miejsce poprzednio â€“ pomimo wszystko i tak przyjemnie siÄ™ mi ich sÅ‚uchaÅ‚o podczas przygody.

W grze wcielamy siÄ™ w indiaÅ„skiego asasyna imieniem Arbaaz Mir, a naszym celem bÄ™dzie odzyskanie SzkatuÅ‚ki PrekursorÃ³w oraz Diamentu Koh-I-Noor, aby to wszystko osiÄ…gnÄ…Ä‡, bÄ™dziemy musieli odszukaÄ‡, oraz zakoÅ„czyÄ‡ Å¼ycie dwÃ³ch ludzi, ktÃ³rzy nazywajÄ… siÄ™ kolejno Alexander Burnes oraz William Sleeman. Akcja produkcji rozgrywa siÄ™ w roku 1841, czyli po wydarzeniach z aktualnie wszystkich znanych czÄ™Å›ci ukazanych do 2016 roku â€“ wszystko to pokazuje nam jak wydarzenia, ktÃ³rych byliÅ›my Å›wiadkami, majÄ… znaczenie dla AsasynÃ³w oraz Templariuszy w pÃ³Åºniejszych latach.

SterujÄ…c Asasynem, bÄ™dziemy przemierzaÄ‡ rÃ³Å¼ne miejsca w Indiach oraz w Afganistanie â€“ sama rozgrywka jest zaprezentowana w 2.5D i nasza postaÄ‡ porusza siÄ™ standardowo po Å›wiecie wykreowanym w 3D jednak tylko w lewo, prawo, gÃ³rÄ™, dÃ³Å‚ oraz zmienia pÅ‚aszczyzny na bliÅ¼szÄ…, oraz dalszÄ…. author: {'steamid': '76561198092486878', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1579789454}
review:
[h1]GRAPHICS[/h1]
	The game has good graphics with a very nice artstyle that fits with the setting.
[h1]ANIMATION & SOUND[/h1]
	The animation is very smooth and well made. Assassinating has a set of animations that are very good but at the end might get repetitive, and the climbing has a smooth animation aswell. The sound and the OST in the game are nothing special but they are ok.
[h1]STORY & CONTENT[/h1]
	The story should take around 5-6 hours and itâ€™s decent but donâ€™t have any expectations. There are some challenges (collect, contracts, assassinations) which should add 1-2 hours of gameplay and it also has a new game plus feature. The difficulty is pretty balanced but some levels will get difficult in some places. The â€œcutscenesâ€ are just still images that sometimes move and have little effects to them but the artstyle is good there aswell.
[h1]BUGS[/h1] 
	You will find some visual glitches and there are bugs that will screw you up and make you die but they are not happening a lot.
[h1]CONCLUSION[/h1]
	Assassinâ€™s Creed Chronicles: India is a well done little game but you might want to buy it at a sale as it's not worth 10 â‚¬. 7/10

review:

+Offer a challenge rarely found in the Assassin creed franchise

-Combat is not the best
-The game offers nothing new over Chronicles China

Overview: Assassins creed Chronicles: India Is more of the same as China. It tries and offers a few different set pieces but it canâ€™t get away from the fact that there is nothing really different from china. If you enjoyed China youâ€™d enjoy this basically.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198051048003', 'num_games_owned': 1276, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1578957578}
review:
Assassin's Creed Chronicles: India review

Graphics: 4/10
Story: 8/10
Combat: 4/10
Movement: 9/10
Pacing: 9/10
Overall: 7/10

I was going into the game with extremely low hopes after seing what the China Chronicles were about.
Turns out all the game was missing was good level design. This game was amazing! While nothing like its 3D counterparts the game was a blast to play and I did some levels multiple times just to improve my score.
The issues of the character not grabbing properly were also minimal in this one.
Overall a pretty nice game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993679220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1578025653}
review:
If you are into sort of trial and error puzzle maps similar to old Commando games then this will appeal to you (although being forced into the clunky-yet floaty combat will frustrate many people who like to take their time). 

I knew it wasn't a full-on open world game like the other titles, but I am already experiencing one-hit deaths (back to the same checkpoint the 11th time in a row) and the controls not working as advertised (sometimes I can do non lethal take downs some times I can't, it's a mystery).  

I'm sure there's a very specific way to approach every level and some people will really like the feeling of finally figuring it out, but this just isn't my game.  I don't have time to replay the same checkpoint over and over and over again.  

It's not like any AC game makes you stick around for the story and riveting characters, but I was hoping for a neat experience in India with some fun stealth and action game play.  Every guard you encounter can essentially one shot you and the controls are way too imprecise to do much of anything about it.  I'm sure if I grinded through for another 10 levels I would become better, but I have 100 other, better games in my Steam library I could be playing instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092204774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1577116097}
review: So I played the game for a while and after some time you get to (SPOILER) Afghanistan where you are supposed to fuck up some towers. All works fine until I get to the second tower, where after some really shity enemy placement, I am supposed to throw a knife at something to get back up and not be blown to pieces by the explosives I just set off. Now the problem is that you can only carry 2 knives and the game wants you to destroy 3 lamps before going to the explosives. You destroy the lamps by throwing knives at them. Since I can only carry 2 I had none left when I was down at the elevator, which meant that I could not advance the sequence and was forced to every 20 seconds over and over again. Fine, you think, just load the last checkpoint and it will be fine. Yeah, I thought the same thing, BUT GUESS WHAT? THE CHECKPOINT IS INSIDE THE FUCKING TOWER WHERE I SPAWN WITH NO FUCKING KNIVES! AND THERE IS NO WAY OF GETTING ANY! I am not going to replay 4 levels and sacrifice another 2-3 hours for a game, made by a AAA company, which softlocks you for playing AS WAS INTENDED! god I fucking hate this shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258523364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1605708964}
review:
Assassin's Creed India is quite a hard game. Especially if you don't know the controls at first. I played half of the game not knowing some controls. I had to look up a guide, which showed me that it's not that hard. You use a GRAPPLING HOOK. Wow I did not know that... So the game could've made it clearer which options you have. Also the graphics are amazing and the game isn't that demanding. I could play it with max settings and a solid 60 fps. It didn't drop below that once.

The story is fine. It's not too deep or lengthy. The characters are quite shallow, which is expected. The thing that bothered me the most is that the enemies have the same voice lines and dialogues with each other. It didn't feel very immersive when you hear for the 5th time in a row that the guards' "salaries are nothing to write home about". 

The game looks like a painting. The colours are warm and the shapes are smooth. It really is a beautiful game.

Anyways the gameplay was great but some of the stages were extremely frustrating and I rage quited a few times. :D
The timed missions were fine although some people say they're too hard. I think they are fine. Best part is the parkour and the killing. You have many different tools in your arsenal. 

Assassin's Creed Chronicles: India is a great game, but it's a shame Ubisoft wasted this fantastic location for a Chronicles game. They could've used India as location for a full Assassin's Creed game. Imagine that.

Ratings:

Gameplay - 9,5
Graphics 9
World / Locations 8
Story 6

author: {'steamid': '76561198045301435', 'num_games_owned': 2017, 'num_reviews': 697, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1563637066}
review: This entry was easily the best of the AC:C series, but very early on I started running into the same game breaking bugs that I had found in the other two entries. Getting stuck in areas that are literally impossible to escape, puzzles that don't recognize your movements, etc. The games are great for the lore of the AC world, but the problem is that they are just too buggy to play without just wasting a lot of time. Overall, I'm giving this one a 4/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030051109', 'num_games_owned': 2997, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1559931021}
review:
If you liked China you may want to purchase this one as well, but be ready to have too many moments, when the game mechanics fail because controls become more or less responsice than you need at the moment. Like extra jumps or not moving behind a pillar when you tell the character to.
Other than that it's still a good stealth game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961801742', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1551771466}
review:
7/10: Assassin's Creed Chronicles - India is the second in the trilogy and continues the quick, 2.5D stealth action from China while introducing more non-lethal options. Solid and brief, if linear compared to standard Assassin's Creed titles.

Assassin's Creed - India has a story that starts out feeling a lot like Aladdin. Arbaaz is a young assassin in love with the princess, but must obtain a mysterious jewel that may be a piece of Eden, as well as a box that is extra familiar to anyone who played the first game in the trilogy. Things go wrong, inevitably leading Arbaaz to rescue her from a terrible fate and face down the Templars who threatened her and their country.

Compared to China where there were no non-lethal options besides avoiding detection entirely, Arbaaz is able to choke out enemies. This has affected the ranking system as well: while the highest rank you can get on any part is still Shadow, the second best ranking is now Silencer, and the worst one being Assassin. As such, while the game is called Assassin's Creed, actually killing anyone is going to earn less points than knocking them out, or better yet, avoiding them entirely. Otherwise the mechanics are identical to the first game, with levels either challenging the player to figure out the best way to traverse the room or race through the level as quickly as possible using running, jumping, climbing, sliding, and killing if absolutely necessary.  

Since the points you earn in the level directly affect the variety and effectiveness of your abilities, the player has no choices to make between levels regarding character build. This linear progression can feel disappointing at times, especially when you get an upgrade to assassination effectiveness when you're explicitly avoiding killing anyone. Replaying the levels on harder difficulties grants an opportunity to earn more points and more improvements to your abilities, but requires beating the entire game first.

The art is thematically consistent with the setting and accentuates everything nicely, from the background displaying a radiant palace to the environments. The color palette for interactable areas remains the same, with red used for climbable surfaces and green for hiding places, so things remain clear to the player.

Assassin's Creed Chronicles - India is a faithful middle to the trilogy and worth it if you're looking for a stealth action game you can play through in a dozen hours, or just wish Aladdin had a more hardcore conspiracy behind it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285424150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1548842437}

author: {'steamid': '76561198419562991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1547916580}
review:
Das Spiel hat mir leider nicht so gut gefallen wie Assassin's Creed Chronicles: China. 
An sich sind die Geschichte, die optische und akustische Aufmachung sowie die Charaktere liebevoll und gut gemacht und auch die Herausforderungen lassen das Spiel zu einem interessanten, manchmal etwas kniffligen dafÃ¼r aber abwechslungsreichen Zeitvertreib werden. 

Was mir allerdings gar nicht gefallen hat, war der Ã¼bermÃ¤ÃŸig groÃŸe Anteil an Time-Runs: auf Zeit laufende Verfolgungen, sekundengenau abgepasste Fluchtversuche sowie Sprung- und Klettersequenzen. Das war bei  ACC: China nicht so extrem und hat mich hier zeitweise etwas genervt. Da ich jedoch jemand bin, der dennoch alles unbedingt schaffen will und nicht gern pausiert, nur weil es gerade schwierig ist, bin ich natÃ¼rlich hartnÃ¤ckig dran geblieben. So hat mich aber z.B. teilweise eine einzige Verfolgungssequenz sehr viel Zeit durch unzÃ¤hlige Versuche gekostet, bis es dann endlich zeitlich hingehauen hat oder man einfach den Weg so intus hatte, dass man nicht mehr viel nachdenken musste und man sich nicht vor lauter Ungeduld oder Anspannung doch aus Versehen verklickt hat. 
Das einzige, was ich richtig gut daran fand, war das Elefantenrennen. Eine sehr schÃ¶ne Idee. ;)
Im Gegensatz zu ACC: China werde ich dieses Spiel allerdings nicht mehr im PLUS-Modus spielen und versuchen, die Datenbank zu vervollstÃ¤ndigen und alles einzusammeln. DafÃ¼r war es mit Ã¼ber weite Strecken einfach zu frustrierend. 

Jetzt bin ich mal gespannt auf MÃ¼tterchen Russland...

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2477, 'num_reviews': 929, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1546569632}
review:
Se vocÃª jogou Assassinâ€™s CreedÂ® Chronicles: China sabe o que esperar desta sequencia, mudando o estilo da arte e a historia (que Ã© bem simples), o resto do jogo Ã© bem parecido, os grÃ¡ficos, sons e jogabilidade sÃ£o os mesmos, nÃ£o arriscaram em nenhum diferencial grandioso. Esse jogo segue o mesmo modelo de escolher se quer passar furtivamente ou no combate em algumas partes, tem furtividade obrigatÃ³ria em outra e como diferencial, mais cenas de perseguiÃ§Ã£o/fuga. Recomendo pra que gosta de jogos de plataformas e da franquia AC, mas nÃ£o recomendo o valor cheio e nem que seja jogado logo em sequencia dos outros Chronicles, tentei e achei muita repetiÃ§Ã£o.
--------------------------
If you played Assassin's CreedÂ® Chronicles: China knows what to expect from this sequel, changing the art style and storyline (which is quite simple), the rest of the game is very similar, graphics, sounds and gameplay are the same, not risked no grandiose differences. This game follows the same model of choosing whether to pass furtively or in combat in some parts, has compulsory stealth in another and as a differential, more scenes of persecution / escape. I recommend that you like platforms games and the AC franchise, but I do not recommend full value and even if it is played in sequence from the other Chronicles, I tried and found a lot of repetition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136407161', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1545956208}
review:
"ACC India" 's got quite a good storyline, though I got somehow dissapointed because of the ones down below. Read it and find out yourself.

[b][u]Positives[/u][/b]
[list]
[*]The game's storyline is more narrative than China. Quite [b][u][i]impressive[/i][/u][/b].
[*]Environment very very well done. 19th Century's India in colors.
[*]Big refferences on the previous game - AC Chronicles China. Strongly connected to Shao Jun.
[*]Arbaaz's arrogance adds it up to the mix. It makes you more relaxed.
[/list]

[b][u]Negatives[/u][/b]
[list]
[*]What the actual F*** is wrong with the combat style?
[*]Looks like using a controller for movement makes it WORSE than it already is. (used an XBOX360 wireless controller for playing it, dunno anythin about keyboard & mouse)
[*]Detection meters look very retarded, and seem to spot you in like 1 second, whilst not even looking at you.
[*]Made me fall asleep as tired as coming from working out at the gym.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355334610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1586, 'last_played': 1541203796}
review:
Okay, tonight I finished another AC Chronicles game and It was pretty much the same as China with a few changes. Here goes my review:

Visual Design - 9 - Gorgeous game as usual from the AC franchise, however I did liked better the artwork of the cutscenes of China. Level design is beautiful, the India atmosphere is a nice change but I will say China was slightly better.

Gameplay - 6 - Pretty much the same as China, that's why I'm giving it a 6. With sidescrollers you can do much more...yet it fails to try new things.

Music - 8 - Nice music but pretty normal in general.

Story - 7 - The story has a nice beginning but yet again these chronicles games are a bit too predictable. I wish they would elaborate more but it is a small short game.

Overall Score: 7.5 - I liked the new feeling of China but this game fails to give me a new flavor... It's pretty much the same with a different skin. I got the 3 chronicles at a discount sale so I am not complaining for what I got. I would not recommend buying it like that (as the combo), just get China.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178893207', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1538708040}
review:
Very decent sidescroller, the level design is good, it doesn't feel repetitive and the art style is in my opinion more astonishing than the previous iteration.

There are some small gameplay improvements over Assassin'S Creed Chronicles: China: you can knock down enemies, which make less noise than killing them, and the smoke bomb lets you pass guarded zones, making the gameplay a little more fluid.

The game is heavily focused on stealth and it's highly rewarded. Unless you have "helix" the combat is dreadful and I avoided it at all cost. The story is slightly more engaging than China, still forgettable, but at least I wanted to see it through to the end.

If you enjoyed Assassin'S Creed Chronicles: China or you like sidescrollers, you will most likely enjoy India; otherwise don't bother, because is more of the same. Still a solid experience if you can get it for cheap.

review: This is probably the best game for beginners to learn about the core mechanics of Asssassin's Creed. How? Make it a sidescroller! But is it worth 10 bucks? .......No. I would say it's worth about five bucks, but either way it is a solid game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994968074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1533691702}
review: The gameplay and solutions work like this: time the platform puzzle **perfectly**, in the singular (and only) way it was developed or you die. There are often no other ways to solve a puzzle, and they've made them so difficult it takes 25+ times before you (example) open a gate, jump up the wall, jump from wall to a rising pillar, jump from that pillar to another to another, then to the opening at the top of the room, with nothing but perfecft timing. And, no, it's not that I'm a bad gamer, nor my reflexes slow... it's just this game often requires the impossible: to anticipate what the game designer has programmed, then do that thing exactly. This is bad game, but that's what I get for trusting anything with the name Assassin's Creed. (for the record, I generally enjoy games when there is more than a single solution to a puzzle; that's good game design. It's simply more engaging, fun, and gives replayability. When a gamer is locked into a single solution, and then the solution is nearly impossible, it is not fun, it's work. And I didn't buy a GAME to work or get frustrated. It's stupposed to be FUN!!!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198438775716', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1531098392}
review: Habiendo jugado previamente la 1ra entrega de china, puedo decir que esta version de india me gusto mucho mas, juego con una mejor dinamica, variedad de escenarios, jugabilidad mas simple, incluso hasta encontre mejor la historia, siendo que los assassins hasta el momento no me han sorprendido por ese apartado, y algo que cambia bastante con la 1ra entrega que este es mucho mas directo, el sigilo siempre esta presente pero hay que matar mucho mas, lo que no esta nada mal. en resumen dejo recomendado el juego!

author: {'steamid': '76561198280342593', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1529341139}
review:
So i just finished the game. And i love it! Okay it's much more difficult than AC C China and has some time pressure parts, but it's still possible to finish. This game reminds my very strong of Prince Of Persia, the old classic games.
So all in all it's a very good game, nice graphics, physics and even KI for my opinion. Please UBISOFT make more of those games cause they are very nice and fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027178470', 'num_games_owned': 1294, 'num_reviews': 331, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1529126643}
review:
La formula se vuelve a repetir pero con mas accion y colores esta vez

En comparacion del primer capitulo de China la historia tiene un poquito mas de carisma, aqui ya se logra hacer una minima conexion con el personaje y nos anima a avanzar en la historia, el arte explota de colores es fascinante, se aÃ±aden nuevos sistemas de combates entre ellos el que mas destaca es el Sniper.

Recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561198274449267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1650665027}
review: Very good game I don't see why it has a lot of bad reviews. The controls are simple to change in the settings menu and you also have to make a Ubisoft account because it's a Ubisoft game which doesn't take that long and the gem requires some meanings of good timing and stealth. This game may also have a few intense fast reaction parts which needs some practice but in general best 2.5D stealth game I've ever played 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198020252515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1529035667}
review:
Very annoying game, most of the time you need to perfom all the difficult moves again and again after you die because of this game auto save feature and ridiculous margin of error, really frustrating!!!

I love Chronicle China very much and this was why i bought this game, now i just fell lucky that i didn't buy Russia together with this game, save me a few bucks!

author: {'steamid': '76561197976822697', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1527489257}
review:
A Beautiful game.  Haven't enjoyed a side-scroller this much since Ninja Gaiden.  I am a big fan of all things Assassins Creed, and the Chronicles games have fit right in.  

On the down-side, I do find the default keyboard controls to be nearly impossible.  A quick keyboard configuration is a small price to pay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012495146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1527348404}
review: When i hit the play button for the first time the game prompted me to create an account on Uplay. But when i tried to create an account on uplay i was not able to as the service was not available. When the service finally started i had to go through a long process of registration. I wonder why i have to setup new accounts on different sites in order to play games purchased from steam. Why am i forced to accept terms of third party websites to play games purchased from steam. This is outrageous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021974608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1522537442}
review:
India ist der wohl schlechteste, frustrierendste und nervigste Teil der ganzen Trilogie.
Der Schauplatz mag ja cool sein, genau so wie einige neue Mechaniken, im Vergleich zu China. Aber..

HÃ¤tte ich mitbestimmen kÃ¶nnen wie man dieses Spiel hier nennt, so wÃ¤re es Trial and Error: Indien.

Ich hab mich in meinen 22 Jahren noch nicht einmal wirklich aufgeregt wenn etwas in einem Spiel nicht klappt, aber das hier war kurz davor mich dazu zubringen, zu schauen ob mein Xbox Controller die Wand im Flug aushÃ¤lt oder nicht. 

Ich hasse diesen Teil. Besonders die letzteren Level, achtung Spoiler bla bla, wo der Typ am MG hockt und einfach random ballert und ebenso random trifft. Entweder trifft er dich direkt wieder am Checkpoint, so dass du spawnst und direkt wieder stirbst, oder kurz vorm Ende erst, so dass du die Kacke nochmal machen musst.

Was mich auch tierisch angekotzt hat ist der Filter der auf dem Spiel liegt. Wer kam auf die Idee diese BildkÃ¶rnung einzufÃ¼gen? Das regt tierisch auf, weg kriegt man es laut Internet auch nicht. An meinem Ende liegt es nicht. China und Russia haben diesen Filter nicht. Und falls es euch im gesamten Durchlauf von India nicht aufgefallen ist, was ich bezweifel, dann schaut euch die Stellen an wo man sich verstecken kann, oder auch einfach nur Ebenen auf denen viel schwarz ist. Hat man es einmal gesehen, nervt es ungemein.

So, das ist mein Senf zu dem Spiel. Ich hasse es. Macht n Bogen um den Mist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063115240', 'num_games_owned': 2836, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 5772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1461, 'last_played': 1589138213}
review:
A side-scrolling Assassin's Creed game based on the graphic novel Assassin's Creed: Brahman.

Story is great and nothing is very different from the book. So if you're a fan of the book, you'll probably love this game.

Game-play has its pros and cons, there are some puzzle-like levels which I like and chase scenes were fun too but the realism is messed up with Helix skills, which basically gives you magical powers and they are required to be used in the game most of the time.

Soundtrack suits the game well enough, it's not great though. The graphics and artworks are really well done.

There are some hard achievements on Uplay for you to complete as well.

I would recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271621062', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1521954979}
review:
From the design perspective the visuals are stunning, the settings are pretty interesting and the fights and challenges entertaining to an extent. However, all this is is ruined by extremely clunky controls that take all the fun away. Two hours into the game, I am yet to use a whistle or a sound bomb. Whatever I do, whatever it says on screen, I faithfully replicate it, and all I get is zilch. 

In the combat training mode, I cannot change the direction which I am facing. If the enemy happens to land at my back, we are stuck there walking forwards and back with the guy stuck to my back. The only way to break the deadlock is by exiting the training mode.

What an utter shame!

author: {'steamid': '76561198437387805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1178, 'last_played': 1521514731}
review:
I've always felt as if the entire Assassin's Creed Chronicles games have been given a bad rap. Though they may not be like the man AC titles, I still find lots of fun with this series since they offer a unique twist on the AC formua, all this coming from someone who has 100% synced every main AC Title. 

Specifically for AC Chronicles India, I feel like this game did a good job learning from the mistakes of the first game. A lot of the mechanics have been fine tuned so that the gameplay is expanded by how the missions are structured. I am also a big fan of the unique art style Ubisoft in ach game. The tapestry like art in this game is visually appealing and really makes it distinct from the first game. The only real problem I had with this game was the pacing as I felt as if the game had too many timed sequences in the main story line as opposed to the more open free world levels that was fun from the first game. 

As an avid AC fan, I recomend this to anyone who would like a fresh take on the old AC formula. It's different, but in no ways bad. Make sure that you get he whole trilogy though since there is an underlying story that brings them all togther!

author: {'steamid': '76561198118896235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1520034591}
review:
Like half of the missions are about you finishing them under a given time. Not cool. Moreover, comparisons with AC China are unavoidable. In general you do not have the same freedom as in AC China to do things your way. 


On the other hand, graphics are good and colourful (although I still prefer AC China aquarela style). If you liked AC China, this game can be good, but wait for a discount. Full price is not worth it.

review:

Assassinâ€™s Creed Chronicles: India es la continuaciÃ³n de de la Saga tipo Spin off de Chronicles lanzado en el 2016 por Ubisoft, en el que se nos da pistas sobre el paradero de la misteriosa caja que poseÃ­a Ezio Auditore perdida por Shao Jun.
Aqui tomamos el papel de Arbaaz Mir, un asesino indio quiÃ©n debe investigar mÃ¡s la naturaleza mistica de la caja, y su funciÃ³n a la par que intenta rescatar a sus seres queridos de manos de los templarios.

BÃ¡sicamente el juego es lo mismo que lo presentado en Chronicles China, sin embargo se nos dan mÃ¡s uso a las habilidades "HÃ©lix", mas capacidad de inventario, y nuevas mÃ©canicas como el uso de armas de fuego para cumplir ciertos objetivos, pero sin embargo no son aprovechados del todo.

Es muy corto con una duraciÃ³n media de 3 horas (1 hora menos que Chronicles China), pero es recomendable que pilles este juego en el pack de trilogÃ­a durante las Ofertas de Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019730955', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1516064022}
review:
Xmas girft from my friend.

At first I liked it, because the Indian architecture and artstyle reminded me of Prince Persia a bit, Halfway through the game I hated the game more and more, because there's way too many obscure little stupid things that get you killed.

Like the part where you have to run away from machinegun fire. It's almost random whether you make it or not, as you climb through the buildings, because you can only climb as fast as the game lets you (you can hold down shift to be a bit faster), maybe gain a little bit of distance with leaps, but even during leaps a stray bullet might kill you - happened to me on several occasions.

The speedrun levels are way worse as well.

The only level I really liked was inside the Vault. First of all, it's the vault - how cool is that! Second, it has lots of cool traps which you can use to kill the enemy. Just a shame it doesn't really reward you well for it with points, because they usually alarm the others, but it's way too fun! The platforming segments in the Vault are fun as well.

Later you'll find tripwire traps as well. You can disarm them, but when you're in a hurry and try to jump over or slide under them, it gets weird, because for whatever reason you sometimes still touch the wire, even if you do the correct movement.

The only addition I can safely say I like in this game is the assassin enemy type. They lurk in dark places and although they can instakill you, so they work much like traps, if you don't spot them. You can take them out with smoke bombs.

Played it through in 5 hours, then there's the usual Game Plus, challenge rooms, blablabla..

Overall I prefer AC Chronicles China far and wide over this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977450814', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1514872433}
review:
I remember why I gave the previous game Assassin's Creed Chronicles: China a low rating because this game has not only refused to improve the game beyond the previous game's initial release I feel that the overall spirit of the series has gotten worse.

Most of the concepts and material has been recycled from China with almost no new gameplay mechanics.

Let's start off with story first and move onto some of the flaws.

You start off with a very bland assassin called Arbaaz who needs to recover a very rare jewel that is said to interact and power Ezio's box which you should be familiar with in China. The story continues over several memory sequences and the whole plot is uninspired and feels like its only there to connect the free-running sequences with duct tape. Also, helix glitches, these pop out of nowhere and make no sense to the story, so random...

Combat is still clunky and horrendous, for more details see my review on Chronicles China.
Control is not as accurate as it seems, leading to constant deaths and restarts
Hard to see where to climb
Sight-cones are glitchy, cheap and even worse than before, sometimes diagonal cones will alert guards if you are standing even 1-2 millimeters [b]outside[/b] the cone.
Puckle gun escape sequence is incredible infuriating and stupid, because if you are [b]too fast[/b] the gun will pre-emptively move ahead and kill you immediately.
The game overall is short, 6-7 hours on a playthrough
Less creative scenarios compared to AC China.

Absolutely frustrating experience.

Only positive note is that it looks somewhat pretty and colorful, also... elephants, yeah.

Would love to see more mini games to appear like this and i hope other can rise to the challenge and beat this game.

review:
Out of all the Asscred Chronicles Iâ€™ve played, this one is my favorite. 

- The game mechanics is the same as China, with the whole tutorial as well. The difficulty of the game is the same hard as to China (with sync time and all the fighting thing). So not much different (I guess)

- Itâ€™s a great change from China because they added more features to the game like pickpocket so you can steal instead of killing/take the enemies down, disguises and sniping from a far. It has more colors now, which made the game REALLY beautiful. The artwork is just so stunning to see. Loving it a lot.

- The songs are very chilling and powerful, I like it very much.

- The lore is the continuation from the previous game (about the box thing), so you get to know more about it and about the character itself as well. I love the main character very much, cause he has a witty character (itâ€™s a good change from all that revenge and vengeance thing) so he was pretty fun to play with.

All in all, this is the best Asscred Chronicles from all three. With such a fun character to play with, I enjoy this game very much. The artwork and the colors is the winner here. If you love colorful tones with outstanding art, and simple stealth game, this is it for you.
- 10/10 Recommend

review:
Cara, esse jogo Ã© bom, mas nÃ£o conseguir gostar mais dele do que do primeiro da trilogia Chronicles, o China, primeiro porque o personagem nÃ£o tem tanto carisma assim, pelo menos eu achei, e a histÃ³ria desse Ã© bem mais rasa, do que no primeiro, acho que foi contada de uma forma bem melhor e mais clara. 

O jogo Ã© uma evoluÃ§Ã£o do primeiro, tem algumas caracterÃ­sticas diferente, devido claro a sua ambientaÃ§Ã£o, se adequando a cultura da india, na qual o jogo se passa, e isso melhorou bastante a imersividade do game, porÃ©m, muito dessas novas mecÃ¢nicas nÃ£o sÃ£o bem "otimizadas", fazendo com que vÃ¡rios pulos e movimentaÃ§Ãµes sejam um pouco impresisas, e isso me deixou um pouco incomodado, diferente do primeiro no qual o jogo tem uma movimentaÃ§Ã£o muito boa, nesse game, a movimentaÃ§Ã£o as vezes "buga" e vocÃª acaba caindo e tendo que voltar tudo. Mas ainda sim Ã© um jogo excelente e muito bem feito, os grÃ¡ficos sÃ£o bonitos para um ambiente em 2.5D, Ã© bem mais colorido do que o China, e o nÃ­vel de dificuldade Ã© similar, sÃ³ a histÃ³ria que nÃ£o curti muito, mas recomendo o jogo, vale a pena a compra da trilogia e dar uma chance a esse spin-off da saga Assassin's Creed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979913660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1701330493}
review:
Assassin's Creed Chronicles: India shows us what a difference a charming protagonist makes in this series. China had the exact same problem Assassin's Creed III had, a humorless and uncharismatic protagonist, and after playing this right after China I can really see the difference it makes on the game experience as a whole since China and India aren't really that mechanically different.

But there are improvements everywhere, both in movement, combat and even pacing. This game has several chase levels and pure puzzle levels which gives the player a break from sneaking around and fighting enemies which can get boring at times because of the combat system. And once again I must say I really enjoyed the callbacks to Assassin's Creed 2 and III in the soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971121754', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1501874673}
review:
This is the second in the Chronicles games and it was a let down from AC:C China. It started off promising with the idea of playing w/o kills and the character seemed interesting. Then the timer levels got a little bit annoying, then the sniper levels where i had to use my mouse to aim and controller to shoot were quick, but something I didn't find added to the game. The final sequence of timers, kill all the guards, and stealthily sneak up on the enemy were more frustrating and of the "i have to memorize the pattern" variety. The payoff at the end was rather meh for me as I was hoping the main character would have a little more personality. The game is decent and worth a cheap pick-up if you like the AC universe and haven't gotten it already. 
One final note, I found some of the quick platforming difficult to see things on. I'm R/G/Br colorblind and the palette in the game was mostly those shades(i think...) which made seeing things like booby traps and where to climb a little more difficult.
Off to play through Russia!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995660955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1490352294}
review:
As a whole, 'Assassin's Creed Chronicles' is a subpar stealth game with a number of more fluid and well executed rivals that came out even before the release of this game. However, if you are a fan of the franchise, you might find the narrative and character diversity and scope refreshing and enough to keep you going through the game itself, which despite not being the best, isn't that bad either and will offer you a bit of challenge here and there.

You can find my full review here: http://thelpq.blogspot.com/2017/06/assassins-creed-chronicles.html.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085476227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1497702314}
review:
The second game in the Assassin's Creed Chronicles series, this time in India.
The environments are beautiful and it really transports you to India.
Don't let the fact that this is a platform game fool you.  You still need to be stealthy and have perfect timing to make it through a level.
Some will recommend playing the game with a gamepad, but I used a keyboard and mouse - no problem.
I really enjoyed this game.  The addition of the Challenge Rooms is a really nice touch - it will definitely help you improve your skills.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121494000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1490829390}
review:
Bon, pour la beautÃ© graphique du jeu c'est beau (Comme pour les 2 autres qui ont chacun leur style). 
Pour ce qui est du reste en revanche...
L'histoire en effet suit le premier opus (qui est en Chine) mais le scÃ©nario est vraiment bateau et n'a rien d'accrocheur.
Le gameplay reste "potable" mais pour la difficultÃ© du jeu...come on !! Je suis une bonne gameuse mais j'avais l'impression de jouer Ã  un jeu qui passe dans "Joueur du Grenier" ! Les interactions entres les plateformes sont AU PIXEL PRÃˆS (alors imaginez la difficultÃ© lors des courses contre la montre) ! J'ai plus vu l'Ã©cran de chargement aprÃ¨s ma mort que le jeu ! Et les ennemis sont alÃ©atoires cotÃ© difficultÃ©. Certes je sais qu'ils ont des classes plus fortes mais un coup je tue quelqu'un Ã  cotÃ© d'eux ils ne voient rien, un coup je me fais insta-kill !
Et est-ce que j'en parle quand des checkpoints te ramÃ¨nent Ã  un endroit ou tu as une fraction de seconde pour rÃ©agir avant de re-mourir dans un effondrement ou dans les flammes ?
Bref, cela enlÃ¨ve absolument tout le plaisir de jouer. 
Mais curieuse comme je suis, j'ai continuÃ© et j'ai mÃªme jouÃ© Ã  celui qui est en Russie. Eh ben sÃ©rieux, mÃªme en mode normal, il est pire que celui en Inde. MÃªme moi qui est une fan des Assassin's creed, je sens que je me suis bien fait arnaquer !
En conclusion, JE LE DÃ‰CONSEILLE FORTEMENT !

author: {'steamid': '76561198154997308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1581219260}
review:
Completely Meh

I RETURNED THIS GAME. This game is fun, looks greats, isn't GPU intensive and the story isn't half bad. The level design can get to you and the combat is satifying for a sidescroller. However, it is basically unplayable with a keyboard and mouse because it wasn't made for that, it was made for a controller. The mechanics aren't broken, they just aren't meant for a keyboard. BUT, then with an xbox or PC controller, they were even worse. So bad that I ended up returning the game. So the game itself: good. Playablility on a PC: basically none.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091666121', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1483940964}
review:
I think the best way to review this game is to compare it to ACC: China, the first in the series. The story continues on from China, as Arbaaz searchs for Ezio's box. 

[u]Better[/u]
-Enviroment, the Indian art style is simply beautiful and colorful, matches the tone of India very well
-Voice Acting, the voices made more sense
-More type of gameplay, but not really (sniping)
-Difficulty, harder than China, but still fun
-Arbaaz is a more interesting character, and the story is better. Arbaaz cares more about his girlfriend than trying to stop evil lol

[u]Not so much better[/u]
-Similar types of levels (running level is pratically the same in China, with elephants as the only difference)
-Skills and weapons are the same, I expected a new kinds of weapons since India is a few hundred years into the future?

Final say: If you liked China, you will like India, but don't play them close together, it will feel very repetitive :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970198884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1483900454}
review: Obwohl ich nicht zu den Geduldigsten gehÃ¶re, muss ich sagen,dass AC India ein sehr gutes 2,5D Plattform-stealth-Spiel ist. author: {'steamid': '76561198143959193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1614009413}
review:
+Gorgeous artsy graphics 
+Fantastic level design
+Good stealth mechanics
+The extra 0.5D actually adds something

-Story is straightforward and predictable
-Combat is basically just spamming block and heavy attack buttons
-If you get spotted, you might as well restart at the latest checkpoint
-Little bit short, but good replayability

Overall a fun game that plays almost like a puzzle platformer, but with brutal murdering of british soldiers. Little bit expensive, but if your pockets are deep enough, worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008305545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483042870}
review:
J'avais apprÃ©ciÃ© l'Ã©pisode China plus pour sa direction artistique que le reste. En somme, un jeu moyen qui lorgne vers Mark of the Ninja sans en avoir les qualitÃ©s. 
Pour cet Ã©pisode se dÃ©roulant en Inde, mes attentes se situaient beaucoup plus sur la partie gameplay que la direction artistique. Au demeurant, je prÃ©fÃ¨re China avec sa DA beaucoup plus tranchÃ©e. Ici, c'est colorÃ© sans pour autant Ãªtre un dÃ©luge de couleurs comme je l'espÃ©rais. Certainement une volontÃ© de ne pas trop charger pour que l'ensemble reste lisible. 

Niveau histoire, on retrouve le Mc Guffin qu'est le coffre et Ã§a se rÃ©sume Ã  peu prÃ¨s Ã  tout. Sans intÃ©rÃªt et parfaitement anecdotique. Les scÃ¨nes entre les missions sont vraiment laides selon mes critÃ¨res et provoquent un lÃ©ger endormissement.

Niveau gameplay, on retrouve les mÃ©caniques introduites par China et quelques petites nouveautÃ©s sympathiques qui sont sous exploitÃ©es comme dans l'Ã©pisode prÃ©cÃ©dent (Les pouvoirs Helix entre autres). Par contre, les dÃ©veloppeurs ont gardÃ© ce qui m'a toujours gonflÃ© dans les Ã©pisodes de la sÃ©rie principale : l'imprÃ©cision et le fait que le perso rÃ©pond mal.
Le problÃ¨me Ã©tant que dans un jeu qui se veut plateformes / infiltration (N'espÃ©rez pas combattre plus d'un garde Ã  la fois sans mourir) et demande, dans certaines phases, de la prÃ©cision et de la dextÃ©ritÃ©, Ã§a fait tÃ¢che. Ces phases de poursuite ou en temps limitÃ© sont une bonne idÃ©e sur le papier et les rater parce que le joueur est mauvais, Ã§a peut passer. Sauf que la plupart du temps, l'Ã©chec est de la faute d'un personnage qui rÃ©pond mal Ã  la commande et Ã§a, c'est rageant. 

Je voulais aussi revenir sur la difficultÃ© : Non, le jeu n'est pas difficile sauf dans certaines phases qui s'apparentent Ã  du die and retry frustrant Ã  cause du manque de soin apportÃ© au gameplay pas de la difficultÃ© de la phase en question.
La durÃ©e de vie est aussi faible que le prÃ©cÃ©dent : 5H sans trop se presser.

En rÃ©sumÃ©, ce n'est pas un mauvais jeu. Si les dÃ©veloppeurs avaient pris de temps pour soigner le gameplay, le jeu serait clairement bon voire trÃ¨s bon avec des idÃ©es intÃ©ressantes. Moyen comme son ainÃ©, mais pas dÃ©sagrÃ©able Ã  petit prix.
Si vous voulez vraiment un jeu dans le genre infiltration 2,5D : Achetez Mark Of The Ninja qui est le maitre Ã©talon en la matiÃ¨re.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042024767', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1482858524}
review:
In knapp 9 Stunden durchgespielt.

Ich hab's im Winter Sale in der "Assassinâ€™s CreedÂ® Chronicles Trilogy" billiger bekommen (Trilogy: 12,49 â‚¬; Einzelspiel: ~4,16â‚¬). Original-Preis 24,99, bzw. einzelnes Spiel circa 10 Euro.

Zur Assassin's Creed Chronilogie passt das Spiel tatsÃ¤chlich sehr gut, allerdings wÃ¤ren mir - im Nachhinein betrachtet - 10 Euro zu viel dafÃ¼r gewesen. Anders als die Hauptspiele, kann man es nicht immer auf einen Kampf ankommen lassen und muss sehr strategisch und geduldig vorgehen. Ein Fehler alarmiert quasi alle Wachen und damit ist man faktisch schon tot.

An manchen Stellen kommt viel Kniffliges und/oder ZeitabhÃ¤ngiges dazu, was mich manchmal einfach zum pausieren des Spiels getrieben hat, um mich wieder etwas zu sammeln und nicht ewig an der selben Stelle zu verzweifeln. Ich vermute auch, dass einige ungeduldige [i]Speed-Gamer[/i] (denen die Geschichte oder Datenbank-EintrÃ¤ge vÃ¶llig egal sind) das Spiel abbrechen wÃ¼rden, weil es ab und zu echt frustrierend werden kann. Aber wer in den 90ern mit bockschweren Spielen aufgewuchs, ist an den 2-3 verzwickten Stellen abgehÃ¤rtet und freut sich dafÃ¼r umso mehr, wenn er es dann doch schafft. :D ... Manche Zeitrennen sind aber absolut nicht auf Gold zu schaffen, wenn man mit seiner Lebenszeit zwischen den Spielzeiten noch etwas Kostbares anzufangen weiÃŸ.

Mir hat aber das "Elefantenrennen" mega viel SpaÃŸ gemacht..! Da war ich ausnahmsweise sogar viel schneller als die Goldwertung es vorgab. :D

Die Geschichte ist schÃ¶n erzÃ¤hlt, hat mich aber nicht dazu inspiriert, das Spiel nochmal im Modus Plus (AusrÃ¼stung & FÃ¤higkeiten, wie am Ende des ersten Durchlaufs) oder Schwer durch zu spielen. Man hat einfach alles gesehen und wirklich lang ist es auch nicht. Einige "Minigames" ([spoiler]Stichwort: Kanone, Gewehr, ...[/spoiler]) frischen die Spielerfahrung sehr positiv auf.

Die Herausforderungs-Modi haben mich gar nicht gereizt und sind zum Teil irre schwer, so dass dich, nach einer halben Stunde Gegner auslesen, der aller letzte Feind kurz anblinzeln muss und die ganze Mission gescheitert ist, weil du nicht gesehen werden darfst.

[list]
    [*]Musik: TOP, immer gut passend, nicht herausragend episch, aber im Prinzip perfekt.
    [*]Gegner: Sehr verschieden. Sehr individuell. Viele verschiedene Klassen und Kampftypen.
    [*]HUD-Grafik: GewÃ¶hnungsbedÃ¼rftig & sehr kantig an manchen Stellen. (SPIELMENÃœ!) - Ãœbrigens sehr geil, wie man zum scrollen auf dieses winzige Dreieck klicken muss und dabei besser die Luft anhÃ¤lt, um den einen Pixel zu erwischen.
    [*]Spiel-Grafik: Sehr schÃ¶n. HÃ¼bsche HintergrÃ¼nde. Der indische Flair ist immer angenehm zu sehen.
    [*]Animus-Datenbank: Interessante, nicht zu Ã¼bertrieben viele Fakten Ã¼ber Orte und Menschen Indiens bzw. des vereinten KÃ¶nigreichs.
    [*]Controller: Hab's anfangs mit Controller versuchen wollen. Aber das kann man glatt vergessen. Springen ging beispielsweise gar nicht. Mangelhafte Portierung.
    [*]UPLAY: Ernsthaft. FÃ¼r kaum sichtbare kritzelige Kleidung, ein anders aussehendes Schwert oder EINEN Song soll mal Units ausgeben? [b]*Vogel zeig*[/b] Sorry. Bei den Ã¤lteren Hauptspielen (zBs. AC:Brotherhood) waren diese Ausgaben wenigens noch lohnenswert oder (ingame) vorteilhaft.[/list]

Kaufempfehlung: Ja, aber nicht fÃ¼r 10 Euro. Vielleicht 7. FÃ¼r ein Spiel, das ein bisschen so wirkt, als sei es fÃ¼r Handhelds konzipiert worden. ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198022413675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1481978410}
review:
Segunda parte del "spin off" plataformero de la saga AssassinÂ´s Creed, en esta ocasiÃ³n viajamos al siglo XIX a las exÃ³ticas tierras de la India y AfganistÃ¡n. Muchas cosas que mejorar tenÃ­a el primero, veremos si lo consiguieron.

En esta ocasiÃ³n controlaremos a Arbaaz Mir, un Asesino que debe recuperar el famoso diamante Koh-i-Noor que se encuentra en manos de los templarios, mientras protege a su amada Pyara Kaur, todo ello mientras asistimos en el transfondo a los conflictos bÃ©licos entre el Imperio BritÃ¡nico y la India y AfganistÃ¡n. Muy interesante el marco en el que se desarrolla el juego, no tanto la propia historia, que resulta tÃ³pica y carente de emociÃ³n, siendo el protagonista un ser ambicioso pero sin demasiado carisma como en personajes principales de otros AssassinÂ´s Creed. Lo que sÃ­ resulta muy Ãºtil es la cantidad de informaciÃ³n y datos histÃ³ricos de una zona algo mÃ¡s desconocida para el gran pÃºblico, utilizando personajes reales e insertÃ¡ndolos en el juego.

En cuestiones grÃ¡ficos el juego ha ganado muchos enteros, si bien es cierto que se podrÃ­a haber pulido mucho mÃ¡s, y al comenzar una zona se deben cargar las texturas, la mejora es ostensible, mientras en China los escenarios eran paupÃ©rrimos, India goza de mucho mayor atractivo, con espectaculares postales y lugares donde reinan los colores exhuberantes y zonas preciosistas. Algunos parajes son una gozada para la tecla F12. El modelado de personajes tambiÃ©n estÃ¡ mucho mÃ¡s diferenciado que en el anterior, y vemos mÃ¡s unidades diferentes.

A las mejoras grÃ¡ficas hay que aÃ±adir multitud de aÃ±adidos que tienen que ver con la jugabilidad. La base es la misma, con sus virtudes y defectos, pues a veces falla el control del personaje, pero se han aÃ±adido tanto nuevos movimientos, todos ellos Ãºtiles en segÃºn quÃ© situaciones, nuevas armas, asÃ­ como mayor interacciÃ³n con el entorno que nos darÃ¡ nuevas opciones para avanzar en los escenarios, dicho sea de paso, no muy extensos, similares en durabilidad al anterior, aunque siempre podremos explorarlo en busca de objetos ocultos para alargar las horas de juego. Un detalle a tener muy en cuenta es que el nivel de dificultad ha crecido, y en algunas partes debemos poner a prueba nuestra pericia en el manejo de los mandos, pues muchas de las misiones son contrarreloj y el margen de error es mÃ­nimo.

Como siempre, lo mejor es pasar desapercibido en la medida de lo posible para conseguir mayor puntuaciÃ³n y acceder a mejoras tanto en el equipo como en nuestras habilidades, aunque la IA enemiga sigue al mismo nivel, todo resulta demasiado prefijado y conociendo los movimientos los pasos a realizar son obvios,  pero a pesar de los enemigos sigue siendo un buen reto el avanzar por cada una de las pantallas. AdemÃ¡s se han aÃ±adido las salas de desafÃ­o que alargan la vida del juego.

En el tema sonoro tambiÃ©n se ha mejorado, las voces no estÃ¡n mal y los sonidos estÃ¡n bastante bien implementados. Las melodÃ­as inspiradas en oriente son mÃ¡s destacables, lÃ¡stima que el nÃºmero sea tan escaso. Los vÃ­deos siguen en la misma lÃ­nea en formato casi cÃ³mic. Todo traducido al castellano, aunque no doblado.

Podemos decir que supone una mejorÃ­a mÃ¡s que evidente en cuanto al primer "Chronicles", en todos los aspectos, destacando por encima de todo unos escenarios preciosistas con espectaculares coloridos y algunas novedades que aportan nuevos elementos a la jugabilidad. Todo ello en un mÃ¡s que interesante perÃ­odo histÃ³rico, aunque se le podrÃ­a haber sacado mayor partido a la historia del juego.

NOTA 7Â´25/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198161079661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1479092623}
review:
El segundo capÃ­tulo de esta trilogÃ­a es un juego superior a todos los niveles respecto del primero, China. En este Chronicles: India encontramos una profundidad jugable muy superior, con una implementaciÃ³n de nuevas herramientas, nuevos movimientos, trampas y objetivos, ademÃ¡s de nuevas mecÃ¡nicas, convirtiendo la jugabilidad en algo mucho mÃ¡s profundo y variado. PrÃ¡cticamente en cada uno de los 10 capÃ­tulos se intentan desarrollar diferentes enfoques en la jugabilidad, incluyendo incluso minijuegos que ofrecen gran diversidad para un juego en 2D. Se ha profundizado en el combate haciÃ©ndolo algo mÃ¡s complejo, con mayor variedad de enemigos y formas de enfrentarnos a cada uno de ellos. Tenemos el chakram, con el que podemos atacar a los enemigos, llamar su atenciÃ³n o destruir lÃ¡mparas para disminuir la visibilidad de los enemigos.
Seguimos ante un juego de plataformas, sigilo y acciÃ³n, pero con un nivel de dificultad superior, ya que se parte de la base del final de China, evolucionando en dificultad y complejidad desde donde quedÃ³ el final del primer juego. Por ello no es recomendable jugar a este India sin haber superado en su totalidad China. De hecho aquÃ­ apenas hay tutoriales y ya en los primeros niveles disfrutamos de gran dificultad sin ayudas, dando por hecho que ya se ha aprendido del anterior juego.
En el plano grÃ¡fico se observa una gran mejora tÃ©cnica, siendo este juego mÃ¡s pulido y mucho mÃ¡s vistoso. AdemÃ¡s el apartado artÃ­stico tan colorido y lleno de detalle con una ambientaciÃ³n como la India, sus calles, palacios, templos ocultos y algunas localizaciones mÃ¡s ofrecen un conjunto mucho mÃ¡s diverso que en Chronicles:China.

La historia ofrece un guiÃ³n en cierta medida mÃ¡s elaborado tambiÃ©n que en la primera parte, aunque sigue siendo algo muy secundario y con poco peso en general. Ã‰sta tiene algÃºn que otro guiÃ±o a la saga clÃ¡sica de Prince of Persia, a los que el juego en general recuerda constantemente, tanto por su ambientaciÃ³n tan similar, como por jugabilidad e historia. TambiÃ©n aÃ±ade unos niveles extra de desafÃ­o donde tendremos que superar retos de obtenciÃ³n de Ã­tems, asesinatos y sigilo con unas determinadas condiciones, obteniendo una puntuaciÃ³n segÃºn el tiempo requerido y las condiciones cumplidas.

En resumen uno de los mejores juegos en 2.5D que he jugado, con una variedad jugable genial, muy buen ritmo y mucha innovaciÃ³n. Un juego muy adictivo, donde en sus 7 horas de duraciÃ³n (mÃ¡s o menos, segÃºn la habilidad de cada uno) siempre estaremos haciendo diferentes tareas en cada nivel, en ningÃºn momento resultando monÃ³tono o aburrido. De hecho pienso que es mÃ¡s recomendable que algÃºn capÃ­tulo de la saga principal de Assassin's Creed.  8'3

author: {'steamid': '76561198049837419', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1561365066}
review:
Assasin's Creed Chronicles:India is a 2.5D Gameplay platform, unlike the main Assasin's Creed Series. This came to my surprise as I wasnt aware of it while purchasing. However, it took a few minutes of gameplay to get used to it and reminded me of old school gaming. The story like it good and I didnt get bored. The gameplay is decent considering the platform and there is some interacting with the environment. 
Considering that I got it at a discount, I believe it was a decent purchase. Would recommend to anyone who is into the Assasin's Creed series or someone who would want to relive the old video gameplay like that of Contra and Duke Nukem!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064850410', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1470869546}
review:
[h1]Teal Deer[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Developers:[/b] Climax Studios 
[*][b]Publishers:[/b] Ubisoft 
[*][b]Initial release:[/b] Jan 2016
[*][b]Genre:[/b] Action, Stealth, 2.5D
[*][b]#Worth/NotWorth:[/b] #Nope
[/list]
[h1]Exposition, Concurrence and Summation[/h1]

India is the 2nd of 3 side-scrolling Assassins Creed games. For most intents and purposes this is more of the same of the China edition. And I'll link that review [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/SpaceCouncil/recommended/354380/]here[/url] for the sake of not repeating the basics. (I also think that is a much better designed game.)

The [b]differences[/b] that India has are as follows: [list]
[*] it introduces non-lethal takedowns
[*] the art style has the color saturation turned all the way up â€“ less Street Fighter IV and more TellTale
[*] character abilities are introduced much quicker such as helix dash, it seems they expect that you played China though it still has what I'd consider an overdone tutorial 
[*] the fighting feels a lot more stilted, it seems they encourage stealth even more (to the degree that some enemies cannot even be killed or taken down without great effort. In some areas it feels forced)
[*] They remove the brawler playstyle in favor of the silencer playstyle
[*] There are traps everywhere that make the traversal a chore
[/list]
I don't like this game, especially in comparison to China. The color saturation in the environment is just too much. It makes the game difficult to just look at and be involved with. 

[b]THE GIST
There are more environmental puzzles and less dealing with enemies in the way you see fit. It feels more directed and forced and overall not as fun.[/b]

[quote]More here â€” [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28295405/]Station Argus[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198113497432', 'num_games_owned': 5894, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1469292444}
review:
[i] Quality goes on a descent into mediocrity [/i]
Just, terrible, even the dialogue and voice acting went for cringe worthy territories.
Its a game that does not understand why the previous title worked
The control scheme remains the same, but the execution fails at spectacular levels.
It ran out of ideas fast, there are no good visual queues and now side missions all work together to apply brakes to the flow of the game.
It reaches the point where you have to stop moving to do snipping mini games, that take forever to complete, on a platformer no less.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989859778', 'num_games_owned': 1848, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1468525536}
review:
Well pretty much the same as AC:China obviously. The story is similar, yet a little thinner than the first game, more straight forward, not so many forth and backs, so somewhat easy to remember.

THe controls are much better done and the assassins learned a few new tricks, but so did the templars.

A nice game if you have the patience.

I encountered just a few bugs, like falling plates that are still visible and seem to block you way, or freeze bugs during combat, which is a death sentence.

Finished in about 6 hours, way too long since I failed so many times...

author: {'steamid': '76561198041365537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1469923922}
review:
If you played ac:china before, in terms of game mechanics, you should feel at home, its a continuation from what you had in ac:china, with some extra mechanics added (like traps, enemies that can hide, etc).

Some parts of the game have some unnecessary difficulty to it, and it doesn't help that you can't save the game at any point, so if you fail you'll have to redo the whole part, which can be a bit frustrating.

You should play ac:china first, before this one, since this one is more difficult, but if you liked ac:china, this is still a good game to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272865034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1461431934}
review:
This game takes you to the land of Amritsar during 19th century located in India in the  , which is beautifully designed by Ubisoft . We play as Arbaaz in his quest for retribution . I love that Ubisoft is taking a step forward for making Assassins Creed Games for Indian fans <3

PROS:
-Despite being a 2.5D game it delivers a enjoyful scenery and a good gameplay
-The controls are easy to understand and best if u use a gamepad
-If u are a fan of stealth based games then go for this
-The game is not that easy , u need to use your brain to go on
-I do love the artwork used in the cutscenes and the voice acting

CONS:
The story is short only taking 9-10hours to complete or less , still a good game

author: {'steamid': '76561198071839963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1667750840}
review: It's a nice game and I enyojned Chronicles China really much, but India has ONE ultimate BIG BUG that makes it unplayable at a point in the Story! When you play it on PC and you are in the Ruins with this Golden shining walls, you need to climb but really nearly at this point of Mission there is a wall that doesen't sink correctly to the ground so you can't move trough this thin passage between the stonewalls... I'm really disappointed of this! So after the half Game is over you can't move forwards... I want my money back because there isn't a being for an Bug fix in the future:( PS: Thx u Ubisoft for another Bug pleasure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032058214', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1460882802}
review:
One of the best AC games so far.

The indian setting has a unique but not at all clichÃ© style, the characters are really kinda bollywood but cooler (sorry, bollywood fans), the story is straightforward but not boring.

Took all the good game mechanics from ACC China and topped it with some more. Remained stealthy but also with more action which resulted in shorter playtime, that's about the only negative thing I can say.

Also big plus for the continuity of the AC universe, not only with the obvious links to ACC China and Russia, but also industrial London with the main character being one of Syndicate's main character's father (I think that's not really spoiler).

I recommend it to all AC fans (after playing through ACC China).

author: {'steamid': '76561198050786210', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1454250279}
review:
Todo lo que aporta respecto a Assassin's Creed Chronicles: China es la nueva ambientaciÃ³n, el resto lo repite, errores incluÃ­dos, y aÃ±ade un nivel de dificultad que estÃ¡ fuera de lugar.

Seguimos sin doblaje a ningÃºn otro idioma a parte del inglÃ©s (lo que resulta raro por parte de una compaÃ±Ã­a francesa...) que da bastante pena, porque por mucho que le pase al protagonista parece tener tantas luces como Connor en AC III. 
La trama llega a ser mÃ¡s aburrida que la de Unity, con un personaje que antepone sus ambiciones a todo pero parece no estar preocupado. 

A nivel grÃ¡fico es muy similar al anterior Chronicles, y lo mismo pasa con su jugabilidad. Lo Ãºnico que destaca es la ambientaciÃ³n de India, con paisajes poco detallados pero muy artÃ­sticos.

En cuanto a su dificultad, es extremadamente alta, basÃ¡ndo la mayor parte del juego en una constante repeticiÃ³n de secuencias. Esto tambiÃ©n sucedÃ­a en cierto modo en Chronicles: China, pero en menor medida. El problema viene cuando un juego que se basa en la repeticiÃ³n y que no requiere mucha potencia aplica pantallas de carga a cada muerte, que se hacen extremadamente largas (y mÃ¡s aÃºn si el PC utilizado no es especialmente potente...). Todo esto hace que la experiencia de juego pase de ser un reto a una inaguantable prueba de paciencia. 
AÃ±adir semejante dificultad a un plataformas de estas caracterÃ­sticas estÃ¡ fuera de lugar, y a la hora de probarlo en sus fases beta o gold los desarrolladores deberÃ­an haberse percatado de que resulta extremadamente difÃ­cil disfrutar del juego.

La fÃ³rmula Chronicles funcionÃ³ cuando era una nueva forma de jugar a un Assassin's Creed, pero si repite absolutamente todo lo bueno y lo malo del anterior juego, todo lo aÃ±adido en cuanto a ambientaciÃ³n pierde su valor, y mÃ¡s aÃºn si la dificultad es demasiado elevada como para fijarnos en el mapeado. Supongo que los que hayan leÃ­do su novela grÃ¡fica quedarÃ¡n complacidos, al igual que los que no hayan probado Chronicles: China, pero yo no le puedo dar mÃ¡s de 4,5/10 porque, a pesar de su reducido precio (que, por otra parte, se agradece), no he disfrutado del juego, no me he entretenido y mÃ¡s de una vez he perdido la paciencia entre enemigos invencibles y bugs ocasionales. Odio tener esa sensaciÃ³n de querer terminar un juego para que se acabe de una vez, y eso es justo lo que siento cuando juego a AC Chronicles: India.
Veremos si Chronicles: Russia innova en algunos aspectos y reduce su dificultad para que, al menos, se pueda disfrutar y jugar a gusto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015399334', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1456527059}
{'steamid': '76561197968565253', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1457803639}
review:
Thumbs up because it's a nice enough game (the stealth parts are good fun, it has nice art, alright music and the voice acting isn't too bad although not too remarkable either) and to counter the probably numerous reviewers who tend to bash Ubisoft titles only because of Uplay.

Still it probably could've been better. It feels a little short, the ending came rather abruptly, and maybe half of the levels - sometimes in direct succession - are timed-based with you having little freedom in your approaches but encouraging to kill guards to get through them quickly as possible, as they are only rated by your speed and not by how many sightings, alerts or kills you've had (or not) as is the case with the stealthy levels. This is rather a downside because if people have ever asked for stealth elements that feel rewarding and fun it's the Chronicles games that of any AC titles have them (Chronicles: China had such time-based levels too, but they didn't feel like taking up as much space as they do in Chronicles: India). Oddly enough there are even parts where you are mostly forced (!) to snipe enemies down with a rifle, sometimes semi-silently, but still in a rather easy and cheaply feeling manner.

The timed-based parts aren't too bad, but can feel forced (Has there ever been a Precursor temple in AC that hasn't collapsed after you went through it? They apparently haven't been the greatest of architects...) and they have their somewhat unnecessarily difficult parts particularily when being in the need of tailing a person. I got slight moments of frustration when having to deal with some unprecise moments in controlling Arbazz during those time-based sections but those were luckily rather few and the checkpoints in this game are placed rather nicely. That aside the controls never felt too bad. Arbazz didn't always do what I wanted, or in the speed I had expected, but once you have your route through a section of guards mapped out and know how to do it it's usually doable in a fair manner.

After you've completed the game you unlock two modes which may give incentive to play the game again to grab all the collectibles (often coming with little lore snipplets), complete secondary objectives, unlock all the character/gear buffs or to play with increased difficulty. You also unlock a couple challenge rooms in Animus VR environment style which actually look pretty nice and fun to play, but I wonder why they didn't create another one or two main game levels if they had time to do these challenge rooms.

The story isn't much worth mentioning. There is a some background lore, which can feel a bit messy, but maybe only to the various names tossed in and out. It's your old Assassins-vs-Templars-arms/power-race thing. There were some nice artifact/Precursor ideas which I don't want to bring up because sort-of-spoilers but they remain vague and never translate into something you can grasp too well, before long you've finished the game and can only hope some of it is used in future titles (some of it is in Syndicate, but I wish there was more).

author: {'steamid': '76561198014496172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1457745868}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960311772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1478220984}
review:
I'm a huge Assassin's Creed fan and I really enjoyed AC China, but somehow they totally screwed this game up. I couldn't bare to play through it even though I painfully forced myself as far as sequence 6, I then gave up..
I played AC China with a gamepad and I played this game with a gamepad, but somehow in this game the controls is not as responsive as in AC China (how?), which makes the character so clumsy in everything it's impossible to bare through this since you can't even kill a single enemy unless done through sneaking, and sometimes not even then. I thought they might had learned something for improvement since AC China, but seems like the opposite.
I really wanted to enjoy this game, but it's impossible somehow. I might just be having a bad day, but after 3-4 hours of trying I can't force myself anymore, it's not enjoyable to play this game.

review:

Durchgerockt am : 21.02.2016

Story ist leider etwas dÃ¼nn
Charakter etwas zu blass
Musik, Aktion, und die Fertigkeiten die man einsetzen muss sind super.

7 / 10 von mir.

Zwar gleichen sich : "China" , "India" und "Russia" ins Sachen Handhabung und teilen sich stÃ¤rken und schwÃ¤chen.                                                                                                            Ich finde aber jedes auf seiner Art der PrÃ¤sentation gelungen. 

Ich wÃ¼rde mich Ã¼ber weitere "Chronicles" Teile freuen.

review: In typical Ubisoft fashion, they took a game that had great promise and pile a lot of crap onto it. You love escort missions and time trials right? Because that's what you'll get in quantities. Did you like the silent methodic approach you learned in AC:C China? Too bad, those are in short supply here. This game is frustration distilled. I'm frustrated by the gameplay, I'm frustrated with the shitty controlls and I'm outright pissed with Ubisoft for pulling yet another Ubisoft.
